Roosevelt ISD is seeking bus drivers for the 2020-21 school year.

Job Duties:
Ensure safe and orderly transportation of students on assigned route. Operate school bus that transports students and other authorized personnel to and from schools or other designated locations.

Qualifications:
• Valid Texas commercial driver's license (Class B) or willingness to obtain one.
• Must be 18 years of age
• Able to pass alcohol and drug test
• Able to complete required bus driver safety training
• Able to follow written and verbal instructions
• Able to communicate effectively
• Able to manage student behavior
• Ability to operate bus

Most routes last less than one hour, and pay $22.00 per route.

For more information contact Darryl Driver, Roosevelt ISD Transportation Director, at ddriver@risdtx.us

The UIL will require that student-athletes arrive at workouts wearing a mask, but anytime they are exercising, the mask may be removed. While athletes are not working out - before starting or during breaks, we will ask them to put their mask on.
We will also invite any incoming 7th and 8th graders who intend on being in athletics to join summer workouts on July 15th. As a reminder, the school cannot provide water bottles, so all athletes coming to workout need to provide their own water bottles. It will be hot, so make sure you plan on bringing water. We can't wait to see our Eagle athletes again, and continue preparing for our upcoming seasons.

post_text: This morning, district administrators became aware that multiple athletes have tested positive for COVID-19. Only one of them has attended workouts and sports specific training within the last week. In response, Roosevelt's administration has decided to indefinitely suspend all boy's and girl's summer strength and conditioning programs until further notice. District officials will reassess the situation of our athletic community, in regards to the COVID19 Virus, on Wednesday, July 15th to determine if it is safe enough to resume summer activities with our athletes. During this suspension period, gyms and weight rooms that were in use for Summer workouts will be off limits to students so that we can thoroughly disinfect the areas that were in use. Thank you for your understanding during these trying times.

Last week only 28.4% of Texans had self-reported. This is even fewer than on the same date ten years ago. Our state ranks 42nd of the 50 states in percentage of the population that has been counted. An accurate count is important because presently the Texas school lunch program receives $2.2 billion a year and the SNAP Program receives $1.5 billion in federal funding, and these funds are based on the census count. The 2020 Census is important to you as a school district leader!

Since children are among the largest under-counted group in Texas, you can help. Please utilize every communication tool you have with your parents and community to urge each family to self-report. Self- reporting can be done by mail, online at my2020census.gov, or by telephone. For English speakers the phone number is 844-330-2020, and for Spanish speakers it is 844-468-2020.

Thanks for your help with this important count for our state and for your school district!

ACE Site Coordinator Opening (Cycle 10-CIS):

Communities In Schools of The South Plains, Inc. is seeking to fill the ACE Site Coordinator position at Roosevelt Elementary to work with students at-risk. Applicants must be able to pass a criminal background check, possess a valid driver’s license, have excellent communication skills, and experience in data entry, activity planning, and supervising. Other duties include implementation of before and after school programs and coordination of community resources to meet student needs.

This position requires a bachelor's degree in social work, education, or related field and three years of experience with student services. Five or more years of experience in management and/or working with at-risk students may be substituted for education. Applications are available at www.cissouthplains.org. Please submit application and resume to hr@cissouthplains.org.

This position is open internally and externally – please share.

Internal applications will be accepted through 12:00 PM on Monday 10th 2020.
